description: {"blocks":[{"key":"c8r41","text":"Primary cortical neuronal-astrocyte cell culture preparation. Dissociation, preparation and plating of mice cortex neurons and glia cells on MEA.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
protocol_affiliation: School of Physics and Astronomy, Tel-Aviv University, Tel-Aviv, Israel

collections.protocol_name: Protocols for activity changes in Neuron-Astrocyte Networks in Culture Under the Effect of Norepinephrine
collections.protocol_name_html: Protocols for activity changes in Neuron-Astrocyte Networks in Culture Under the Effect of Norepinephrine

authors_list.name: Yasmin Bar El
authors_list.affiliation: School of Physics and Astronomy, Tel-Aviv University, Tel-Aviv, Israel

status_info: We use this protocol in our group and it is working

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"5do5l","text":"Dissect cortices from pups and place them on ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6hjmk","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"f02df","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"key":"1ri07","text":"Cortical cultures were prepared from post-natal day 0 or 1 mice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}}],"guid":"6A0805C0BB1811E898A283C0560613D6","id":665164,"previous_id":null,"previous_guid":null,"section":"Sample collection"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2rvf8","text":"1. Chop with scissors in a papain-based dissociation buffer [2.5 mM CaCl2, 0.83 mM EDTA, 137 U papain (Sigma-Aldrich)], 100 \u03bcl DNAse (Sigma-Aldrich), 3\u20135 crystals of L-Cysteine (Sigma-Aldrich), HBSS with 20 mM HEPES (pH 7.4);","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3jlg2","text":"2. Place on a rotating shaker at 50 rpm for 15 min  at room temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":50,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"986aj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ccnuv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":0,"guid":"9712CBF0BB1C11E8BB4E8920014B3BF0","duration":900,"label":"","step_guid":"88E04B10BB1811E898A283C0560613D6"}}],"guid":"88E04B10BB1811E898A283C0560613D6","id":665165,"previous_id":665164,"previous_guid":"6A0805C0BB1811E898A283C0560613D6","section":"Cell lysis"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2p39u","text":"1. After centrifuging (1000 rpm,1 min), discard the supernatant, resuspend the pallet in modified essential medium (MEM) without L-glutamine with essential amino acids (Beit Haemek, 06-1025-01-1A), 5% heat-inactivated\u00a0fetal calf serum (Biological Industries), heat-inactivated\u00a0 5%\u00a0horse serum (Beith Haemek, 04-004-1), 2 mM glutamine (Beit Haemek, 03-020-1c), 3 mg\/ml glucose, 2%\u00a0B-27 (Gibco, 17504-044), 0.5%\u00a0Pen\/Strep (100 U\/ml penicillin, 100  \u03bcg\/ml streptomycin; Beit Haemek, 03-031-1B);","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8hfg1","text":"2. Triturate seven times by slowly passing the tissue through a 10 mL serological pipette until the tissues are smaller than the opening of the 1 mL pipette tip.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"AD8824B0BB1811E898A283C0560613D6","id":665166,"previous_id":665165,"previous_guid":"88E04B10BB1811E898A283C0560613D6","section":"Cell preparation"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"22b8r","text":"1. Plate the cells on poly-D-lysine (PDL, Sigma-Aldrich, P7405-5MG) coated micro-electrode arrays (MEAs; 200\/30iR-Ti-gr and 500\/30iR-Ti-pr; Multichannel Systems) with a cell density of 2000-2500 cells\/mm2 (~106 cells per dish);","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2mm7","text":"2. Cultures were maintained at 37 \u00b0C with 5% CO2. Partially replace growth medium every 3-4 days [MEM-EAGLE (without L-glutamine with essential amino acid), 5 mg\/ml glucose, 5%\u00a0heat-inactivated fetal calf serum, 0.8% GlutaMAX (100X; Gibco, 35050-038), 0.5%\u00a0Pen\/Strep, 2 mM glutamine, 2%\u00a0B-27].","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"C89F6A60BB1811E898A283C0560613D6","id":665167,"previous_id":665166,"previous_guid":"AD8824B0BB1811E898A283C0560613D6","section":"Cell culture"}
